treeQuadrature.trees.limited_sample_tree module¶

class treeQuadrature.trees.limited_sample_tree.LimitedSampleTree(weighting_function: ~typing.Callable[[~treeQuadrature.container.Container], float], N: int = 1000, active_N: int = 0, split: ~treeQuadrature.splits.base_class.Split = <treeQuadrature.splits.min_sse_split.MinSseSplit object>, queue: ~treeQuadrature.queues.ReservoirQueue | None = None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tree

construct_tree(root: Container, integrand: Callable, verbose: bool = False, max_iter=1000.0) → List[Container][source]¶

Actively refine the containers with samples.

Parameters:

  • root (Container) – The root container with all initial samples.

  • integrand (Callable) – The integrand function.

  • max_iter (int, optional) – Maximum number of iterations, by default 1e4.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output, by default False.

  • max_iter – Maximum number of binary splits, by default 2000.

Returns:

A list of finished containers.

Return type:

List[Container]

treeQuadrature.trees.simple_tree module¶

class treeQuadrature.trees.simple_tree.SimpleTree(split: ~treeQuadrature.splits.base_class.Split = <treeQuadrature.splits.min_sse_split.MinSseSplit object>, P: int = 40, max_iter: int = 2000, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tree

Construct the tree using a simple queue (with no priority). Stopping Criteria: when all containers hold less than P samples.

construct_tree(root: Container, verbose: bool = False, max_iter=1000.0) → List[Container][source]¶

Construct a tree of containers.

Parameters:

  • root (Container) – The root container with all initial samples.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output, by default False.

  • max_iter (int, optional) – Maximum number of binary splits. by default 2000.

Returns:

A list of finished containers.

Return type:

List[Container]

treeQuadrature.trees.weighted_tree module¶

class treeQuadrature.trees.weighted_tree.WeightedTree(weighting_function: ~typing.Callable[[~treeQuadrature.container.Container], float], max_splits: int = inf, active_N: int = 0, stopping_condition: ~typing.Callable[[~treeQuadrature.container.Container], bool] = <function default_stopping_condition>, split: ~treeQuadrature.splits.base_class.Split | None = None, queue: ~treeQuadrature.queues.ReservoirQueue | None = None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Tree

A Tree subclass that constructs the tree using a weighted queue mechanism for prioritisation. Stopping Criteria: when stopping_condition is met.

max_splits¶

a limit on the number of splits the integrator can perform. Default : np.inf

Type:

int or np.inf

split¶

the method to split the containers

Type:

Split

weighting_function¶

maps Container -> float to give priority of container in queue

Type:

Callable[[Container], float]

active_N¶

the number of active samples to draw before a container is split. Default: 0

Type:

int

n_splits¶

actual number of splits

Type:

int

stopping_condition¶

maps Container -> Bool to indicate whether container should no longer be split

Type:

Callable[[Container], bool], optional

queue¶

where containers are pushed and popped from along with their weights

Type:

ReservoirQueue, optional

construct_tree(root: Container, integrand: Callable[[ndarray], float], verbose: bool = False) → List[Container][source]¶

Construct the tree using a weighted queue mechanism.

Parameters:

  • root (Container) – The root container with all initial samples.

  • integrand (callable) – The integrand function to be integrated.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output, by default False.

treeQuadrature.trees.weighted_tree.default_stopping_condition(container: Container) → bool[source]¶
